question: Is HASS pathway a requirement?
answer: Yes, all undergraduate students are required to take a 12-credit HASS Integretive Pathway.

question: Can I change my pathway later?
answer: Yes, as long as you are able to complete the requirements of the pathway before you graduate.

question: Is a HASS Inquiry course required as a part of a pathway?
answer: While a HASS inquiry course is a HASS Core requirement, it can be sperate from your pathway. However, some pathways require completion of an Inquiry Course as a part of its requirements

question: Is 4000-level course a requirement?
answer: Depending on your pathway, you may be required to take a 4000-level course. However, make sure to check the individual pathway requirements

question: Is CI course a requirement?
answer: No, you are not required to take a Communication Intensive as a part of your pathway.

question: Can I create my own pathway?
answer: No, students cannot create their own pathway.

question: Can my pathway count toward minor?
answer: Yes, lots of pathways even have an associated minor which sometimes might only require one more course to achieve!

question: Can I use the pathway from other years?
answer: No, you may only complete a pathway from the academic catalog year you started at RPI.

question: Can any course in the pathway be designated as P/NC?
answer: No, you cannot Pass/No Credit a class in your HASS Pathway.

question: By when do I have to declare a pathway?
How do I declare a pathway?
answer: You can declare your pathway in SIS.
